New Records: De'Aaron Fox scored 49 points, and his 109 points over a two-game span are the most in team history.
Key Match Events: The Kings battled back from a deficit, tying the game at 107 with 5:25 remaining, and then scored five straight points to take the lead.
De'Aaron Fox converted 1 of 2 free throws with 38.8 seconds left to give the Kings a 119-116 lead.
The Jazz failed to grab the rebound when Clarkson missed the second attempt intentionally.
Pre-Game Insights: The Kings played without Domantas Sabonis (lower back tightness), DeMar DeRozan (low back tightness), and Malik Monk (right ankle sprain).
Post-Match Reflections: De'Aaron Fox expressed his team's effort after the comeback win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: De'Aaron Fox made three 3-pointers and scored 18 points on 7-of-7 shooting overall in the first quarter.
The Jazz led by as many as 11 in the third quarter before the Kings rallied.
Others: The game featured six ties and 14 lead changes.
